faqs.question: Which champagne houses do you buy?
faqs.answer: We buy prestige cuvees and vintage champagne from Dom Perignon, Krug, Cristal, Salon, Bollinger, Taittinger, and other collectible houses. We also consider grower champagnes from sought-after producers.

faqs.question: Do you buy non-vintage champagne?
faqs.answer: We focus on vintage champagne and prestige cuvees. Non-vintage champagne from common producers typically does not meet our criteria unless it is from a collectible grower.

faqs.question: How important is storage for champagne?
faqs.answer: Storage is very important for champagne. Bottles stored at proper cellar temperatures retain better quality and value. If you know your storage conditions, include that information.

faqs.question: What condition issues affect champagne values?
faqs.answer: Cork pushing, seepage, excessive ullage, and heat damage significantly reduce or eliminate value. Cosmetic label wear is less critical but still affects offers.

faqs.question: Does the original box matter?
faqs.answer: Yes. Original gift boxes and presentation packaging add value for prestige cuvees. Include photos of any original packaging.

faqs.question: Do you buy larger format champagne bottles?
faqs.answer: Yes. We buy magnums, jeroboams, and other larger formats. Large format champagne often commands premium prices due to better aging and rarity.

faqs.question: How do I know if my champagne is still good?
faqs.answer: Look for normal fill levels, intact corks without pushing, and no visible seepage. Send photos and we will evaluate. Champagne from unknown storage may need assessment.

faqs.question: How quickly will I receive an offer?
faqs.answer: We typically respond within one business day for champagne submissions.
